intro: Lasiacis excavata, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to eastern Africa. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its velvety, dark green leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a perennial herb, often forming a compact rosette structure. Its flowers come in a variety of colors, including purple, pink, and white, and are adapted for pollination by insects. Lasiacis excavata is widely cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its aesthetic appeal and ease of care.
